Pre-Game Insights: The USA men’s national cricket team is prepared to compete against Bangladesh at the Prairie View Cricket Complex in a significant three-match T20 International (T20I) series.
The USA Team enters the upcoming series with a strong sense of assurance, having secured a commanding 4-0 victory against Canada in the previous month.

Captain Monank Patel played a pivotal role by scoring 120 runs in three innings, supported by notable performances from Steven Taylor, Andries Gous, Corey Anderson, Shadley Van Schalkwyk, and Nitish Kumar.

Harmeet Singh emerged as a game-changing all-rounder with outstanding bowling skills, clinching the Player of the Series title for his six wickets at an impressive average of 12.55 per dismissal, alongside contributing 48 runs during the series.
Bangladesh will arrive in the USA following a successful 4-1 series triumph over Zimbabwe.
Despite a recent eight-wicket loss in their final match, they displayed consistent all-around excellence throughout.
However, due to injury, experienced fast bowler and vice-captain Taskin Ahmed will be absent from the squad, with Hasan Mahmud stepping in as his replacement.
With seasoned players like Shakib Al Hasan and Mustafizur Rahman on their side, Bangladesh is anticipated to be the favored team at the start of the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series will serve as valuable preparation for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, scheduled to be co-hosted by the West Indies Cricket Board (WICB) and USA Cricket in June.
Live Telecast in North America: Willow TV
Party stand: $40 (includes beer and soft drinks)
Tickets available online: Eventbrite (or contact 504-875-9581 for ticket information)
